meanings.definition: A person who believes in the existence of a plenum.
meanings.sent1: The plenist was convinced that the universe was filled with matter.
meanings.sent2: She met a plenist at the conference who shared her views on cosmic abundance.
meanings.sent3: The plenist joked that their house was so full, it resembled a plenum.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a plenum of ideas, just like a library filled with books.
meanings.sent5: The plenist's passion for a full universe was contagious to all who listened.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the belief in a plenum.
meanings.sent1: The plenist theory proposed a universe without empty spaces.
meanings.sent2: Her plenist perspective influenced her scientific research.
meanings.sent3: The plenist design of the room made it feel cozy and complete.
meanings.sent4: The plenist sky at night seemed to stretch endlessly above them.
meanings.sent5: The plenist artwork depicted a world brimming with life and energy.
